description: An iconic 9x19mm pistol, for a crazed yakuza.
A pair of 60-round extended magazines compatible with Redemption & Absolution.
A pair of military issue 30-round box magazines originally intended for use with Redemption & Absolution.
This is a pair of nailguns.  It is an overall much more effective weapon.  Now comes in two.
A fairly harmless pistol that shoots small paintballs.  Now comes in two.
A fairly harmless revolver that shoots small paintballs.  Now comes in two.
A harmless revolver that shoots small paintballs.  Now comes in two.
A cheap copy of an old shotgun, possibly antique.  It is little more than a pair of barrels, a wood stock, and a hammer to strike the cartridges.  Now comes in two.
An improvised... pistol?  Well, you can use this as a ranged weapon, but it is almost useless.  You have been warned.  Now comes in two.
A multistroke pneumatic pistol handcrafted from scrap.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  It is pretty quiet and quite deadly.  Now comes in two.
A multistroke pneumatic pistol for shooting competitons.  Be careful where you reload it, pumping air into the tank takes a few seconds.  Very quiet and quite deadly.  Now comes in two.
A dart gun is an air pistol that fires a dart.  It could also be used as an ad-hoc weapon.  Due to it's special mechanism, it can stun a target.  Now comes in two.
A toy gun, which uses air pressure to fire a small tethered or untethered projectile out of a barrel, most often via piston action though sometimes via spring pressure.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated blunderbuss pistol.  Good old version of a 12 guage pistol.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated blunderbuss pistol.  Good old version of a 12 guage pistol.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.
A beautifully decorated flintlock pistol.  If using this doesn't make you feel a pirate, nothing will.  Now comes in two.

A small concealable pistol-like crossbow.  It's weak due to its small size and draw, so it is best suited for hunting small game.  Bolts fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.  Now comes in two.

A small concealable pistol-like crossbow.  It's weak due to its small size and draw, so it is best suited for hunting small game.  Nails fired from this weapon have a good chance of remaining intact for re-use.  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads discs.  Surprisingly, those discs does not just include normal frizbees, but more.  Now comes in two.

A modified version of the classic hand crossbow which utilizes marbles as projectiles instead of the traditional bolt.  Primarily intended for hunting small game, stronger people can reload it much faster.  Now comes in two.

A small underwater fishing implement designed to fire a specialized type of spear using tension in a rubber band.  While highly effective when used underwater, it is nearly useless on dry land.  Now comes in two.
A plastic single shot pistol that can be loaded with signal flares.  Now comes in two.
This V29 laser pistol was one of the first handheld laser weapons.  It is larger than most traditional handguns, but displays no recoil whatsoever.  Now comes in two.
The Colt Model 1861 Navy cap & ball .36-caliber revolver was a six-shot, single-action percussion weapon produced by Colt's Manufacturing Company from 1861 until 1873.  Now comes in two.
The Colt Army Model 1860 is a cap & ball .44-caliber revolver.  It was used during the American Civil War, and made by Colt's Manufacturing Company.  Now comes in two.

This 7.5" barreled Uberti Cattleman is a modern reproduction of the legendary Colt Single Action Army, or Colt Peacemaker, one of the first revolvers to use a modern self-contained cartridge.  Made famous by westerns, it is still in demand for Cowboy Action Shooting, reenactors and collectors.  Unlike modern revolvers, the cylinder cannot swing out for loading, and spent brass must be ejected one at a time.  Now comes in two.

A small, chubby derringer pistol bearing a slight resemblance to the Mossberg Brownie.  It uses a rotating firing pin to fire the individual hammers of the four barrels arranged in a square formation.  Now comes in two.
The Bond Arms Derringer is a series of multi-barrel compact pistols.  Most commonly chambered for .45 Colt, with chambers long enough to accept .410 shotgun shells.  Now comes in two.

As the descendant and the better reproduction of Medusa Model 47, this revolver is specially made for most types of ammunition.  Due to some up-to-date tech, there are no problems in order to load and shoot various types of ammo.  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol made from 1874 Sharps rifle.  Now comes in two.

The S&W 1917-M46 is the compact revolver counterpart to the S&W 1917-R46 rifle, both chambered in 4.6x30mm.  With a reinforced frame and extended cylinder, it brings the rifle’s precision and punch to a sidearm format.  Now comes in two.

The S&W 1917-M57 is the compact revolver counterpart to the S&W 1917-R57 rifle, both chambered in 5.7x28mm.  With a reinforced frame and extended cylinder, it brings the rifle’s precision and punch to a sidearm format.  Now comes in two.
A sawn-off elephant gun.  Just like obrezs or Luparas, this is also a pistol version of the rifle version.  Used for self defence, and could be still used for self defence.  Now comes in two.
A plastic single shot pistol, modified from a flaregun, that can be loaded with acids.  Now comes in two.
Made to spray some liquid, especially water, this thing is just a toy.  What did you expect?  You are not gonna use this... right?  Now comes in two.

The Mauser C96, or broomhandle, is a semi-automatic pistol that was originally produced by Germany.  It was pretty good, but it was the unique shape that kept the gun famous untill now.  Now comes in two.
This ammo clip can hold 10 rounds of 7.62x25mm and quickly reload akimbo Mauser C96.  Now comes in two.
A break-action single-shot pistol which was introduced in 1967 by Thompson/Center Arms.  It can be chambered in various cartridges.  Now comes in two.

This 7.5" barreled Uberti Cattleman was modified to hold an ammo belt, not a cylinder.  However, the reload mechanism is still the same, so the user have to reload the bullets one by one.  Now comes in two.

This 7.5" barreled Uberti Cattleman was modified to have a special ammo effect, which makes the user to hit multiple targets at once at the cost of shorter range.  
"You're Pretty Good."  Now comes in two.

This is a type of blaster that was a standard-issue handgun for the New England Police Department Blob Ruinner Unit.  Looks like it was constructed from parts of a revolver and a rifle.  Now comes in two.
A .223 revolver, custom made.  This is a one-of-a-kind firearm, obviously made with love and skill.  Now comes in two.
A seven-round revolver made in soviet union.  Also known for the usage of suppressor on a revolver, thanks to it's unique mechanism.  Now comes in two.
A revolver produced by Italian manufacturer Chiappa Firearms.  Its most distinctive feature is that the barrel is on a much lower bore axis.  Now comes in two.
A Korean revolver, which was for the police.  This civilian model excludes it's unique smart module.  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads .308 Winchester.  Now comes in two.
Popular among children.  Good for plinking, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  Now comes in two.
Popular among children.  Good for plinking, and easliy modifiable, but BBs deal nearly no damage.  Now comes in two.
A brother of the old COP .357 derringer, this model uses .410 shotshells as it's ammunition.  Good for finishing a job.  Now comes in two.
This is a scrappy laser pistol made from common components.  Weak, but can be powered with UPS.  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads 12 gauge shotgun shells, handcrafted from scrap.  Now comes in two.
A double shot pistol that loads two 12 gauge shotgun shells, handcrafted from scrap.  You can fire it one by one, or you can fire both barrels at the same time.  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads 40mm grenades, handcrafted from scrap.  Pocket sized ka-boom it is!  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads .410 shells, handcrafted from scrap.  Now comes in two.
A double shot pistol that loads two .410 shells, handcrafted from scrap.  You can fire it one by one, or you can fire both barrels at the same time.  Now comes in two.
A six-shot revolver, produced since 1899 and known as the most popular handgun of the 20th century.  It has a swing-out cylinder for ease of reloading.  Now comes in two.
A six inch, six-round revolver chambered in .357 Magnum/.38 Special.  Favorite of sheriffs and post-Cataclysm survivor group leaders.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 6 rounds of .357 Magnum or .38 Special and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.

A stainless steel, six-shot, double-action revolver with a matte black plastic handle manufactured by Smith & Wesson.  Though hardly the most powerful handgun in the world any more, it could still blow a zombie's head clean off.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 12 rounds of .44 and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.

One of the most powerful handguns in the world when it was released in 1979, the Redhawk offers very sturdy construction, with an appearance that is reminiscent of "Wild West" revolvers.  Now comes in two.
The 5-shot Smith and Wesson 500 revolver fires the comparably-named .500 S&W Magnum.  It's an impressive weapon.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 10 rounds of .500 and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.
The Smith and Wesson 610 is a classic six-shooter revolver chambered for 10mm rounds, or for S&W's own .40 round.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 12 rounds of .40 and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.
A seven-round .38 revolver sold by Smith & Wesson.  It features a fixed rear sight and a reinforced frame.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 7 rounds of .357 Magnum or .38 Special and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.
A compact, double-action-only revolver designed for easy concealment, with a stainless steel cylinder and aluminum frame.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 5 rounds of .357 Magnum or .38 Special and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.
A compact, double-action-only revolver designed for easy concealment, with a stainless steel cylinder and aluminum frame.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader can hold 8 rounds of .22 and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.

The first gun produced by O.F. Mossberg & Sons.  A small pocket pistol, marketed to trappers during the early 20th century.  Its four barrels can accept .22 Short and .22 LR cartridges.  Now comes in two.
Considered overkill by some, the Rivtech M99 remains an exceedingly powerful addition to the arsenal of any gunslinger.  Now comes in two.
This speedloader, made by Rivtech for use with RM99 revolver, can hold 5 rounds of 8x40mm caseless rounds and quickly reload a compatible akimbo revolver.

A Pietta reproduction of the civil war era LeMat revolver, a rare and unusual cap & ball .44-caliber revolver.  While its original non-standard .42 or .35 caliber curbed its usefulness for the CSA army, this reproduction is offered in more prevalent .44 caliber.  Despite modern quality materials, the design is still rather delicate.  Now comes in two.

A scrappy and bulky reproduction of the civil war era LeMat revolver, this one use the older paper cartridge ammo.  Despite modern quality materials, the design is still rather delicate.  Now comes in two.

A large and heavy revolver evidently welded from scrap.  It's not pretty, but the .45 and .44 it's chambered with packs a serious punch.  Just watch out for the kick.  This one is especially made so that the suppressor is avilable to use.  Now comes in two.
A large and heavy revolver evidently welded from scrap.  It's not pretty, but the .45 it's chambered with packs a serious punch.  Just watch out for the kick.  Now comes in two.

A massive single-action revolver.  While the .45-70 rifle round loses significant velocity in its short pistol barrel, it still competes with other large magnum handguns in terms of power.  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads 12 gauge shotgun shells.  Handy sidearm in the apocalypse.  Now comes in two.
A revolver modified to accept shotgun ammo, it can hold 3 cartridges.  Now comes in two.
The Taurus Lightning is a 5-shot revolver chambered in .308.  It has impressive stopping power.  Now comes in two.
The Taurus Dragoon is a 5-shot revolver chambered in 7.62x39mm and 7.62x54mm.  It has impressive stopping power.  Now comes in two.
A Breech-loading, single shot handgun designed to fire the .50 BMG cartridge.  Reconstruct the word "Hand Cannon".  Now comes in two.
A single shot pistol that loads 20x66mm shotgun shells.  Handy sidearm in the apocalypse.  Now comes in two.
Considered overkill by many, the Taurus 550 samaritan remains an ultimate powerful sidearm to the arsenal of anybody.  Now comes in two.
A police weapon designed and developed in Russia.  Accepts 9x18mm cartridges.  Now comes in two.
A M1911 that loads and shoots metal rails, for special operators during special missions.  Now comes in two.

Essentially a slightly scaled up Kel-tec P32 in .380 ACP, the ever popular P3AT offers better ballistics in a small, concealable lightweight package.  Handling leaves something to be desired due to snappier recoil and diminuitive controls.  Now comes in two.
A standard 6-round steel box magazine for the akimbo Kel-Tec P3AT.  Now comes in two.

Made infamous in Sarajevo in 1914, the FN1910 was a popular pocket pistol, albeit in .32 ACP.  Collectors value the .380 model for its notoriety and more modern terminal performance.  If such a humble firearm could start a world war, could it perhaps protect you from the undead?  Now comes in two.
A standard 6-round steel box magazine for the akimbo FN 1910.  It looks a bit old.  Now comes in two.

One of the best-selling modern day 'pocket pistol's, the LCP is an affordable, polymer framed pistol chambered in .380 ACP.  Despite the round's relatively low power, the pistol's low weight and short sight radius make for a moderately poor handling pistol.  Now comes in two.
A standard 6-round capacity magazine for the Ruger LCP pistol.  Now comes in two.
The Hi-Point CF-380 is a blowback operated semi-automatic pistol designed by Hi-Point Firearms.  Hi-Points have slides made with a zinc pot-metal.  Now comes in two.
An 8-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point CF-380.  Now comes in two.
A 10-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point CF-380.  Now comes in two.
A .380 subcompact pistol.  Designed for concealed carry and built from high-quality, durable materials.  Now comes in two.
A compact, 6-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Taurus Spectrum.  Now comes in two.

A full-sized version of the highly successful Glock, chambered in hard-hitting 10mm Auto.  The third model of Glock designed, all other full-sized, large framed Glocks are adaptations of this one.  Now comes in two.
A compact light-weight steel and polymer magazine for use with akimbo Glock pistols chambered for 10mm Auto.  Now comes in two.
An extended 30-round polymer magazine for the akimbo Glock 20.  Now comes in two.
Made to fit the akimbo Glock 20.  This drum magazine holds 50 rounds.  Now comes in two.
A popular, small .22 LR pistol.  One of the many polymer frame pistols produced during the latter 20th-early 21st centuries; it has an underbarrel rail.  Now comes in two.
A factory specification 10-round magazine for the akimbo SIG Mosquito.  Now comes in two.
A popular .22 pistol.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity magazine for the popular S&W 22A pistol.  Now comes in two.

One of the quintessential 'saturday night specials', the Jimenez JA-22 was very affordably priced with its injection molded zinc slide and frame.  Intended to fill the void left after small pocket pistols were banned from import, these were more commonly used by criminals unfazed by their glaring safety issues.  Now comes in two.
A cheap 6-round steel box magazine for the Jennings J-22.  Now comes in two.

The Walther P22 is a blowback operated semi-automatic pistol.  It is about half the size of most Walthers.  It is made mostly with plastic, with the slide and key components being made of die-cast zinc alloy.  Now comes in two.
A 10-round box magazine for the akimbo Walther P22.  Now comes in two.
The SIG Sauer P230 is a small, semi-automatic handgun chambered in .32 ACP.  Due to its small dimensions, it was often carried as a backup weapon.  Now comes in two.
A factory specification 8-round magazine for the akimbo SIG Sauer P230.  Now comes in two.
One of the most famous handguns of the 20th century.  Your name is not Bond, but you might find this little gun still useful.  Now comes in two.
A standard 8-round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPK.  Now comes in two.

One of Kel-tec's oldest designs, the P32 is a popular option for deep concealment and backup usage.  Despite its extreme light weight and small size, its .32 ACP chambering makes for good handling and recoil control.  Now comes in two.
A standard 7-round steel box magazine for the akimbo Kel-Tec P32.  Now comes in two.
A SIG Sauer P226 chambered for .357 SIG.  The P226 is a DA/SA, short-recoil operated semi-automatic pistol.  Now comes in two.
A 12 round double stack box magazine for an akimbo SIG P226 chambered for .357 SIG rounds.  Now comes in two.
A full size .357 SIG Glock pistol.  It is extremely similar to the Glock 22, and could be converted to fire .40 S&W by switching the barrel.  Now comes in two.
A compact light-weight polymer magazine for use with akimbo Glock pistols chambered for .40 S&W or .357 SIG.  Now comes in two.
An extended 22-round magazine for use with akimbo Glock pistols chambered for .40 S&W or .357 SIG.  Now comes in two.
A 50-round drum magazine for use with akimbo Glock pistols chambered for .40 S&W or .357 SIG.  Now comes in two.

name.str: akimbo KRISS Vector .40 S&W/.357 SIG magazine

description: A 32-round modified Glock 22 magazine with a +17 MagEx kit installed, intended to be used with a KRISS Vector in .40 S&W.  Can also fit in akimbo Glock 22s.  Now comes in two.
The P320 Compact is a semi-automatic, short recoil operated pistol.  This one is chambered for .357 SIG.  Now comes in two.
A 13 round double stack box magazine for the akimbo SIG Sauer P320.  Now comes in two.
A double-barrel semi-automatic pistol of Italian origin, firing two bullets per shot, a derivative of the M1911 pistol.  Now comes in two.
Two .38 Super 8-round box magazines attached to a single base plate, holding up to 16 rounds in total, used by akimbo AF2011A1 double-barrel pistol.  Now comes in two.
The M1911A1 is an extremely popular pistol known for its reliability.  This one is chambered for .38 Super.  Now comes in two.
A compact single stack box magazine for the akimbo M1911.  Now comes in two.

A more modern version of Beretta's popular 92 series of handguns, the 90-two performs largely the same.  The main difference is a sleeker, almost futuristic-looking design owed in large parts to the polymer underbarrel rail cover.  This one is chambered in .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.
A magazine for the akimbo 92 and 96 series of Beretta handguns, this one is for .40 S&W and can hold 12 rounds.  Now comes in two.
A .40 S&W variant of the popular Glock 17 pistol.  The standard-issue firearm of the FBI and of countless other law enforcement agencies worldwide.  Now comes in two.

Lighter than Beretta's iconic 92 series of guns, the Px4 Storm was built by utilizing light-weight polymer construction with steel inserts.  Its shape was also optimized for concealed carry.  This one is chambered in .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.
A magazine for the akimbo 92 and 96 series of Beretta handguns, this one is for .40 S&W and can hold 12 rounds.  Now comes in two.
Originally marketed as a lightweight and compact alternative to older SIG handguns, the Pro .40 is popular among European police forces.  Now comes in two.
A compact and reliable magazine for use with the akimbo SIG Pro .40 pistol.  Now comes in two.

The Browning Hi-Power is a semi-automatic handgun developed shortly before the second world war.  Widely issued since then, it remains in use by India, Canada and Australia.  This is a commercial variant produced by Browning Arms in .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.
A 10 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Browning Hi-Power .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.

The Walther PPQ is a semi-automatic pistol originating from the Walther P99QA, and maintains compatibility with some of its predecessor's accessories.  This model is chambered in .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.
A 10 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.
A 12 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.
A 14 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ .40 S&W.  Now comes in two.

The Hi-Point Model JCP is a blowback operated semi-automatic pistol designed by Hi-Point Firearms, which is known for making inexpensive firearms, and for making said firearms bulky and uncomfortable.  Hi-Points have slides made with a zinc pot-metal which is relatively fragile compared to steel slides.  Now comes in two.
A 10-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point Model JCP.  Now comes in two.

One of the most recognizable handguns due to its popularity in movies and video games, the Desert Eagle is better known for its menacing appearance than its performance.  It's a large pistol, but its heavy weight reduces recoil.  Now comes in two.
A standard 7-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo IMI Desert Eagle.  Now comes in two.
The M1911 was the US Military standard-issue sidearm for most of the 20th Century.  It remains one of the most popular .45 pistols today.  Now comes in two.
A military issue 7-round magazine for use with the akimbo M1911 handgun.  Now comes in two.
An extended 10-round magazine for use with the akimbo M1911 handgun.  Now comes in two.

The M45A1 supplanted earlier M45 MEUSOC pistols in use by Force Recon elements of Marine Expeditionary Units.  Where the original M45 pistols were gutted M1911A1's hand-fitted by USMC armorers, the updated M45A1's are hardly different from any other commercial 1911 design save for their dual recoil springs.  Most were replaced in 2016 with Glock 19's due to logistics issues.  Now comes in two.
The AMT Hardballer is a stainless steel clone of the Colt M1911A1 made by Arcadia Machine & Tool.  Reliable, almost like the original.  Now comes in two.
The M1911 was the US Military standard-issue sidearm for most of the 20th Century.  It remains one of the most popular .45 pistols today.  Now comes in two.
A military issue 7-round magazine for use with the akimbo M1911 handgun.  Now comes in two.
An extended 10-round magazine for use with the akimbo M1911 handgun.  Now comes in two.
Modified 1911, which shoots .45 bullet in full auto.  Also have a built-in foregrip.  Now comes in two.
A popular pistol, widely used among law enforcement.  Extensively tested for durability, it has been found to stay accurate even after being subjected to extreme abuse.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity magazine for use with the akimbo H&K USP handgun.  Now comes in two.

Jokingly referred to as "The World's Only Crew-Served Pistol", this massive pistol was designed as a primary weapon for select "special operators".  Its cumbersome nature, the introduction of the derivative HK USP series and the logistics of getting .45 ACP ammunition in theater doomed this behemoth to US SOCOM armories.  Like the USP, the Mk 23 is a remarkably reliable gun; someone could probably take out a nuclear equipped walking tank with this in their holster.  Now comes in two.

The Walther PPQ is a semi-automatic pistol originating from the Walther P99QA, and maintains compatibility with some of its predecessor's accessories.  This model is chambered in .45 ACP.  Now comes in two.
A 12 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ .45 ACP.  Now comes in two.

The Hi-Point Model JHP is a blowback operated semi-automatic pistol designed by Hi-Point Firearms, which is known for making inexpensive firearms, and for making said firearms bulky and uncomfortable.  Hi-Points have slides made with a zinc pot-metal which is relatively fragile compared to steel slides.  Now comes in two.
A 9-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point Model JHP.  Now comes in two.
A full-sized version of the highly successful Glock.  This model is chambered in .45 ACP.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity magazine for use with the akimbo Glock 21.  Now comes in two.
Made to fit the akimbo Glock 21.  This drum magazine holds 40 rounds.  Now comes in two.
A 30-round modified Glock 21 magazine with a +17 MagEx kit installed, intended to be used with a KRISS Vector .45ACP.  Can also fit in akimbo Glock 21.  Now comes in two.
Unlike the previous model, this Canik TP454 is huge, but gives a stable recoil for a .454 round pistol.  A hand cannon suits for the apocalypse.  Now comes in two.
A standard 8-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Canik TP454.  Now comes in two.

The Springfield XD-45C is an imaginary variant of the XD line, chambered in classic .45 Colt for a blend of old-world stopping power and modern ergonomics.  Its polymer frame tames recoil while preserving the round’s heavy impact.  A fusion of tradition and tactical reliability, it stands out as a unique sidearm choice.  Now comes in two.
A standard 8-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Springfield Xd 45C.  Now comes in two.
Short for Universal Combat Pistol, that was developed as a competitor of FN Five-Seven.  Only accepts small magazines.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity 20-round magazine for use with H&K's proprietary 4.6x30mm round akimbo pistols.  Now comes in two.
Short for Universal Combat Pistol, that was developed as a competitor of FN Five-Seven.  Only accepts small magazines.  Now comes in two.
Designed to work with FN's proprietary 5.7x28mm round, the Five-Seven is a lightweight pistol with a very high capacity, best used against armored opponents.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity magazine for use with the akimbo FN Five-Seven.  Now comes in two.
Designed to work with FN's proprietary 5.7x28mm round, the Five-Seven is a lightweight pistol with a very high capacity, best used against armored opponents.  Now comes in two.
A factory issue translucent polymer box magazine that fits with the frame of the FN P90, or akimbo P50.  Now comes in two.
Designed to work with FN's proprietary 5.7x28mm round, the Five-Seven is a lightweight pistol with a very high capacity, best used against armored opponents.  Now comes in two.

This lightweight machine pistol fires 5x50mm armor-piercing flechette cartridges.  Classified as an individual defense weapon, this advanced firearm was developed by Rivtech for the US military shortly before the end of the world.  Designed to be fired in bursts, it excels in close combat.  Now comes in two.
A 50 round box magazine for use with 5x50mm akimbo flechette firearms.  Now comes in two.
A 100 round box magazine for use with 5x50mm akimbo flechette firearms.  Now comes in two.

The Tokarev TT-33 is an antique Russian semiautomatic pistol, famous for its durability, accuracy, and uncomfortable grip angle.  It was chambered for the 7.62x25mm due to the popularity of the C96 pistol among Russian revolutionaries.  Now comes in two.
Standard 8-round magazine for akimbo Tokarev TT-33.  Now comes in two.
Considered overkill by many, the Rivtech M103A remains one of the most powerful sidearms ever developed.  Accepts stick magazines.  Now comes in two.
A 10 round stick magazine for use with Rivtech 8x40mm caseless akimbo firearms.  Now comes in two.
A 25 round stick magazine for use with Rivtech 8x40mm caseless akimbo firearms.  Now comes in two.

A more modern version of Beretta's popular 92 series of handguns, the 90-two performs largely the same.  The main difference is a sleeker, almost futuristic-looking design owed in large parts to the polymer underbarrel rail cover.  Now comes in two.
A military issue 15-round box magazine originally intended for use with the akimbo Beretta M9 handgun.  Now comes in two.
A 30-round extended magazine compatible with the akimbo M9 handgun.  Now comes in two.
Possibly the most popular pistol in existence.  The Glock 19 is often derided for its plastic construction, but it is easy to shoot.  Now comes in two.
Designed for all shooters, the Glock 17 is marketed towards law-enforcement and military.  Now comes in two.
A selective fire variation on the Glock 17, originally designed for Austria's EKO Cobra unit.  It has compensator cuts along its barrel to make recoil more manageable.  Now comes in two.
A compact light-weight polymer magazine for use with Glock compatible akimbo firearms.  Now comes in two.
Made for the akimbo Glock 17, this magazine holds 17 rounds.  Now comes in two.
Made for the akimbo Glock 17, this magazine holds 22 rounds.  Now comes in two.
An extended 30-round polymer magazine for use with Glock compatible akimbo firearms.  Now comes in two.
Made to fit most Glock akimbo pistols.  This drum magazine holds 50 rounds.  Now comes in two.
Made to fit most Glock akimbo pistols.  This drum magazine holds 100 rounds.  Now comes in two.
A 40-round modified Glock 17 magazine with a +23 MagEx kit installed, intended to be used with a KRISS Vector 9mm.  Can also fit in akimbo Glock 19.  Now comes in two.

An iconic 9x19mm pistol, the M9 was the standard issue sidearm of US armed force from 1985 only until recently.  It was formerly popular amongst law enforcement before the advent of commercially available polymer-framed handguns and the FBI's adoption of .40S&W.  Now comes in two.
A pistol which used some parts of M9, this burst-fire machine pistol is one of the most scucessful machine pistols in history.  Now comes in two.

Lighter than Beretta's iconic 92 series of guns, the Px4 Storm was built by utilizing light-weight polymer construction with steel inserts.  Its shape was also optimized for concealed carry, while maintaining the reliability the 92 series is known for.  Now comes in two.
The standard magazine for the akimbo Beretta Px4, in 9x19mm.  Now comes in two.
A popular pistol, widely used among law enforcement.  Extensively tested for durability, it has been found to stay accurate even after being subjected to extreme abuse.  Now comes in two.
A popular pistol, widely used among law enforcement.  Extensively tested for durability, it has been found to stay accurate even after being subjected to extreme abuse.  Now comes in two.
A factory specification 15-round box magazine for use with the dependable akimbo H&K USP 9x19mm pistol.  Now comes in two.

The Kel-Tec PF-9 remains one of the most popular backup pistols due to its history of reliability, affordability, and concealability.  Chambered in 9x19mm, recoil is best described as unpleasant, and follow-up shots are difficult to place quickly.  Now comes in two.
A standard 7-round steel box magazine for the akimbo Kel-Tec PF-9.  Now comes in two.
The M17 is a semi-automatic, short recoil operated pistol derived from the SIG Sauer P320.  Now comes in two.
A standard 7-round steel box magazine for the akimbo Kel-Tec PF-9.  Now comes in two.

The Browning Hi-Power is a semi-automatic handgun developed shortly before the second world war.  Widely issued since then, it remains in use by India, Canada and Australia.  This is a commercial variant produced by Browning Arms in 9x19mm Parabellum.  Now comes in two.
A 13 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Browning Hi-Power 9x19mm.  Now comes in two.
A 15 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Browning Hi-Power 9x19mm.  Now comes in two.

The Walther P38 is a semi-automatic handgun adopted shortly before the second world war.  Developed due to the high production costs of its predecessor, the Luger P08, the P38 is also chambered in 9mm Parabellum.  This early DA/SA locked-breech design would introduce features later seen on more modern firearms such as the Beretta 92 series, and served Germany until 2004.  Now comes in two.
An 8 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther P38.  Now comes in two.

The Walther PPQ is a semi-automatic pistol originating from the Walther P99QA, and maintains compatibility with some of its predecessor's accessories.  This model is chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum.  Now comes in two.
A 10 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ 9mm.  Now comes in two.
A 15 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ 9mm.  Now comes in two.
A 17 round steel box magazine for the akimbo Walther PPQ 9mm.  Now comes in two.

The Hi-Point C-9 is a blowback operated semi-automatic pistol designed by Hi-Point Firearms, which is known for making inexpensive firearms, and for making said firearms bulky and uncomfortable.  Hi-Points have slides made with a zinc pot-metal which is relatively fragile compared to steel slides.  Now comes in two.
An 8-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point C-9.  Now comes in two.
A 10-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point C-9.  Now comes in two.
A 15-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Hi-Point C-9.  Now comes in two.

The CZ-75 is a semi-automatic pistol developed in Czechoslovakia, and is one of the original wonder nines.  Though designed for export to western countries, it was declared a state secret; lack of international patent protection meant that many clones and variants were produced and distributed around the world, with Česká zbrojovka only joining in the 90's.  This pistol remains wildly popular among competition shooters.  Now comes in two.
A 12-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo CZ 75.  Now comes in two.
A 20-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo CZ 75.  Now comes in two.
A 26-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo CZ 75.  Now comes in two.

The Walther CCP is a gas-delayed blowback semi-automatic pistol intended for the concealed carry consumer market.  Internally, it is nearly identical to the cult classic H&K P7.  Its fixed barrel design makes it potentially more accurate than many other pistols, though this may difficult to realize with its average trigger and short sight radius.  Now comes in two.
An 8-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo Walther CCP.  Now comes in two.
This 3D printed machine pistol is made completely without any metal parts.  As a result, it is very lightweight.  Now comes in two.

The Pistolet Makarova was developed by the Soviet Union to replace the WWII-era TT-33 pistol.  It uses the 9x18mm cartridge, which remains in use among various former Soviet countries.  Now comes in two.
The standard magazine for the akimbo Pistolet Makarova, holds 8 rounds.  Now comes in two.
Modified Makarov PM, which shoots 9x18mm cartridge in full auto.  Also have a built-in foregrip.  Now comes in two.
A high-capacity drum magazine for the RARAN Prototype 1130, modified from PPSh-41 drum magazine.  Now comes in two.
A pistol made for use by artillery and mortar crews, tank crews and aircraft personnel.  Uses 9x18mm ammo.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity magazine for the akimbo Stechkin APS pistol.  Now comes in two.
Not as famous as the Desert Eagle, but this firearm is also famous as 'No. 2 of the heavy handguns.'  Is visible from various games, movies, and anime.  Now comes in two.
A standard 6-round steel box magazine for use with the akimbo AMT AutoMag.  Now comes in two.
A pistol perfect for backpacking, camping and range day plinking.  Now comes in two.
A standard capacity magazine for the akimbo PMR-30 pistol.  Now comes in two.
The Calico M950 is an automatic pistol with a unique circular magazine that allows for high capacities and reduced recoil.  Now comes in two.
A surprisingly compact 50-round helical magazine for use with the akimbo Calico M950 pistol.  Now comes in two.
